More on Variables

1. You can't define a variable more than once

let petName = 'Weasley'
let petName = 'Tom' // will show error
console.log(petName) 

let petName = 'Weasley'
petName = 'Tom' // will work
console.log(petName) // output: Tom

2. There are rules related to variable names

  • $, _, a-z, no numbers at start of name
  • $ and _ are only allowed symbols
let 3 = 2 // will show error
let result = 3+4 // will work

3. Variable names cannot be reserved keywords

let let = 12 // will show error
let lett = 12 // will work

Temperature converter

let fahrenheit = 32

// Calculate celsius and store in celsius variable
// print that value
let celsius = (fahrenheit - 32) * 5 / 9
console.log(celsius)

output: 0

let fahrenheit = 32

// Calculate kelvin value and store in variable
// print that value
let kelvin = (fahrenheit + 459.67) * 5 / 9
console.log(kelvin)

output: 273.15

Booleans

let isFreezing = true
let isFreezing = false

Booleans have only two values: true or false

Comparison operators

=== - equality operator
!== - not equal operator
< - less than operator
> - greater than operator
<= - less than or equal operator
>= - greater than or equal operator

If statements

If statements are used for conditional logic
